title: News: The Reflektors – First UK Date
body:
An image has emerged on Twitter of a poster stating that The Reflektors, the pseudonym that Arcade Fire have used in recent secret shows, will be performing at the Blackpool Empress Ballroom on the 27th November 2013.

There has yet to be an official announcement from the band themselves.

> JUST SEEN THIS IN LIVERPOOL! HAS ANYONE ELSE SEEN ANYTHING?! AMAZING!!! [#reflektors](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23reflektors&src=hash) [#arcadefire](https://twitter.com/search?q=%23arcadefire&src=hash) [pic.twitter.com/VaM6sxY0cW](http://t.co/VaM6sxY0cW) — Kieran Crosby (@keyclevermusic) [October 25, 2013](https://twitter.com/keyclevermusic/statuses/393749759288410112)

If this poster is to be confirmed by the band, this would be Arcade Fire’s first UK show since the release of ‘Reflektor’, which itself was made available to stream by the band only yesterday. Arcade Fire’s last UK shows were in September 2011, over two years ago.

**Update**: NME have confirmed through Ticketmaster that this show is indeed set to go ahead on the 27th November. Other outlets have also reported that tickets will go on sale on Friday 1st November.
